Name: Anderssen's Opening
Description: Uncommon, aims for flank control and avoids main lines.

Name: Larsen's Opening
Description: Hypermodern, fianchettoes queen's bishop for queenside pressure.

Name: Bird's Opening
Description: Aims to control e5, can lead to sharp or closed positions.

Name: Réti Opening
Description: Hypermodern, flexible, often transposing to other openings.

Name: English Opening
Description: Flank opening, aims for queenside control, very flexible.

Name: Queen's Pawn Game (Unusual replies)
Description: Covers various less common responses to Queen's Pawn.

Name: Indian Game (Atypical replies to 1...Nf6)
Description: Covers various less common Indian systems when White avoids 2. c4.

Name: Dutch Defense
Description: Asymmetrical defense, fights for e4 square, can be aggressive.

Name: King's Pawn Opening (Unusual replies)
Description: Covers uncommon Black responses to King's Pawn other than 1...e5, 1...e6, 1...c5 etc.

Name: Scandinavian Defense
Description: Black immediately challenges White's central pawn.

Name: Modern Defense (Robatsch)
Description: Hypermodern, Black allows White to build a center then attacks it.

Name: Pirc Defense
Moves: 1. e4 d6 2. d4 Nf6 3. Nc3 g6
Description: Hypermodern, aims for a kingside fianchetto and counterplay.

Name: Sicilian Defense
Description: Popular and aggressive counter-attacking defense for Black.

Name: French Defense
Description: Solid defense, leads to closed or semi-closed positions, Black aims for counterplay on the queenside.

Name: King's Pawn Game (Open Game variations)
Description: General category for various lines in the Open Game.

Name: Center Game
Description: White immediately opens the center.

Name: King's Gambit
Description: Aggressive gambit where White sacrifices a pawn for rapid development and attacking chances.

Name: Philidor Defense
Description: Solid but somewhat passive defense, Black aims for a strong pawn structure.

Name: Petrov's Defense (Russian Game)
Description: Symmetrical and solid defense, often leading to drawish positions.

Name: Italian Game (Giuoco Piano)
Moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5
Description: Classical opening, focuses on rapid development and central control.

Name: Ruy López
Description: One of the oldest and most popular openings, aims for long-term pressure.

Name: Queen's Pawn Game
Description: Classical opening, leads to a variety of closed and semi-closed positions.

Name: Queen's Gambit
Description: White offers a pawn for central control and development initiative.

Name: Grünfeld Defense
Moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5
Description: Hypermodern defense, Black allows White to build a center then attacks it, especially the d4 pawn.

Name: Catalan Opening
Description: White combines Queen's Gambit with a kingside fianchetto, positional and solid.

Name: King's Indian Defense
Description: Hypermodern, Black allows White a central pawn majority, aiming for counterplay, often involving a kingside attack.
